subgroups.description: build a script that compiles the code for production
Code is automatically built and tested through a CI server

Basics (Code Complete): concise commenting, intermediate variables, no long functions, well-factored self-documenting code, eslint is setup
skillsets: Can write well formatted with proper spacing and indentation.
Can write descriptive, well-named functions, variables, files, CSS classes
Commit messages are concise and descriptive.

subgroups.description: SOLID principals, knows popular eslint configs, and what eslint rules to break
Has worked on larger code base with multiple developers, to see/participate in larger code base organization across multiple team
Has worked on a project over a long period with multiple developers, to see common pitfalls and what is actually practical and maintainable
Good names for files, variables classes, methods etc. Attention paid to commit messages. Consistent white space usage.
No long functions, comments explaining unusual code, bug fixes, code assumptions functions. Clean, precise commit messages.
Code assumptions are verified using asserts, code flows naturally - no deep nesting of conditionals or methods. Commit messages tell a coherent story.
Methods are grouped logically or by accessibility. Basic separation of code into logical folders.
Code is grouped into regions and well commented with references to other source files. Each physical file has a unique purpose, for e.g. one class definition, one feature implementation etc.

Code organization at a physical level closely matches design and looking at file names and folder distribution provides insights into design. Physical layout of source tree matches logical hierarchy and organization. The directory names and organization provide insights into the design of the system.
